bounty_id: MSS_Cjuicy_bounty
greetingText: Your screen crackles a bit before the connection stabilizes, and you are greeted by a man in a faded blue coat. In the corner of the screen you can see what appears to be his bridge crew, all somewhat flummoxed at the situation. "Hey there! Are you joining us too? Stars sure are pretty out here, away from all the fighting." Incredulously you shake your head, and he stops in thought for a moment. "Well then, Lets see what happens today on Total. Drama. Corvus!"
intelText: An oddball of an individual, Cristobal "Juicy" McLane was a decorated commander of a Mayasuran Spec-ops fleet. After a disaterous run-in with pirates en-route to another mission, he spent nearly 9 years in a coma due to head trauma. Upon waking up, his personality was completely different, and before long he ran off, gathering his old fleet and escaping into the abyss. Rumors have spread about his fleet being used to facilitate unusual death games, and Mayasuran authorities have now elected to post a bounty on his head.

bounty_id: MSS_Kart_bounty
greetingText: The Kart shows up on your comm screen, surrounded by men with strange and silly round helmets. With a distinctive breathing sound filtered from his obnoxiously large mask, he flips it up saying "I canåt breathe in this thing!"
intelText: Your colleagues in the Mayasuran Navy have reports of a famous tournament spec Mokarran piloted by The Kart. His reputation as a pirate of the lost Astropolis raiding the Mayasura system is well known. A favorite tactic of his seems to be spoofing his transponder under Mayasuran codes while salvaging damaged (M) ships.
fleetVariantIds: MSS_Moa_Elite, MSS_Moa_Stormhawk, MSS_Stingray_Elite, MSS_Stingray_Elite, MSS_Stingray_Elite, MSS_Stingray_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite, MSS_Perryi_F_Elite

bounty_id: MSS_Zyrithithrall_bounty
intelText: Careful Commander, a rogue individual known as Zyrith Thrall has rebelled against Mayasuran Research and Development by stealing a prototype Champion (M). Seemingly naming the new prototype after himself, heís holed up with a fleet of other Overdriven Mayasuran ships.
fleetVariantIds: MSS_Hammerhead_Overdriven, MSS_Hammerhead_Overdriven, MSS_Hammerhead_Overdriven, MSS_Tiburo_Overdriven, MSS_Tiburo_Overdriven, MSS_Tiburo_Overdriven

bounty_id: # NOTES
# bounty_id : line ID. Must be unique across all mods. I recommend a prefix
# level : character level of bounty captain
# rank : must match a rank ID in Ranks
# firstName : bounty captain's first name
# lastName : bounty captain's last name
# captainPersonality : must match a value from Personalities
# fleetName : full name of bounty fleet
# flagshipName : name of flagship. Needs to include prefix as it won't have it otherwise
# gender : must match a gender enum in FullName
# faction : faction id for bounty fleet and captain
# portrait : filepath for bounty portrait. Must be loaded by the game
# greetingText : full text that displays if/when you open comms with bounty fleet
# suppressIntel : if TRUE do not show intel event when bounty spawns
# postedByFaction : faction shown in intel panel as issuer of bounty. Also faction which rep reward applies to
# creditReward : credits paid out for bounty
# repReward : reputation points with issuing faction paid out for bounty on a 100 point scale
# intelText : text what goes in the intel panel
# flagshipVariant : variant ID of bounty flagship. Will NOT use autofit
# fleetVariants : comma seperated list of variant ids for rest of bounty fleet. Will NOT use autofit
# minimumFleetFP : random autofit faction ships will be added to fleet until its FP passes this number. Will NOT use autofit
# playerFPScalingFactor : random faction ships will be added to fleet until its FP passes the player fleet FP multiplied by this number. Will NOT use autofit
# chanceToAutoRecover : fractional chance to automatically recover with maximum D-mods. Does NOT affect standard recovery chance. Optional: default 1 aka 100%
# specialItemsList : comma seperated list of special item ids dropped by fleet.  CURRENTLY DOES NOT WORK SORRY

# neverSpawnUnlessBountiesCompleted : comma seperated list of unique bounty IDs required to be in 'spent bounties' list before bounty will spawn. Will account for bounties which have been manually deactivated via script as well as those are 'spent' to remove them.
# neverSpawnWhenFactionHostile : if TRUE never spawn when player is hostile to issuing faction
# neverSpawnWhenFactionNonHostile: if TRUE never spawn when player is friendly or neutral to target faction
# neverSpawnBeforeCycle : if over 206 never spawn before said cycle
# neverSpawnBeforeLevel : if over 1 never spawn when player is below said character level
# neverSpawnBeforeFleetPoints : if over 1 never spawn when player fleet is less than said fleet points
